briefdescription.para: Links to the provided ConfigOption. Assumes that the parameters have already been parsed from the config file.

parameterdescription.para: the parsed ConfigOption object

briefdescription.para: Imports the spatial variables from a path to the config file..

parameterdescription.para: string of the path to the config file

briefdescription.para: Main import of parameters from the config file option.

memberdef.argsstring: (const long long &job_type, const long long &seed, const string &output_directory, const unsigned long &max_time, unsigned long desired_specnum, const string &times_file)
memberdef.name: setKeyParameters

parameterdescription.para: the job type reference number, used for file referencing
the seed to set random number generation
the output directory
the maximum time to simulate for
the desired number of species to aim towards (currently not functional)
the file containing a list of temporal sampling points

memberdef.argsstring: (const long double &spec_in, bool is_protracted_in, const double &min_speciation_gen_in, const double &max_speciation_gen_in)
memberdef.name: setSpeciationParameters

briefdescription.para: Sets the speciation parameters for the simulation.

parameterdescription.para: the speciation rate to use
if true, simulates as a protracted simulation
the minimum speciation generation for protracted simulations
the maximum speciation generation for protracted simulations

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &dispersal_method_in, const double &sigma_in, const double &tau_in, const double &m_prob_in, const double &cutoff_in, const double &dispersal_relative_cost_in, bool restrict_self_in, const string &landscape_type_in, const string &dispersal_file_in, const string &reproduction_file_in)
memberdef.name: setDispersalParameters

briefdescription.para: Sets the dispersal parameters for the simulation.

parameterdescription.para: the method of individuals dispersing (normal, fat-tailed or norm-uniform)
the sigma value for a normal distribution
the tau value for the fat-tailed distribution
the probability of uniform dispersal for the norm-uniform distribution
the maximum dispersal distance for the uniform distribution
the relative cost of dispersing through non-forest
if true, prevents dispersal from the same cell
the landscape type (infinite, tiled or closed)
a map of dispersal probabilities
a map of reproduction probabilities

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &historical_fine_file_map_in, const string &historical_coarse_map_file_in, const double &gen_since_historical_in, const double &habitat_change_rate_in)
memberdef.name: setHistoricalMapParameters

briefdescription.para: Sets the historical map parameters for the simulation.

parameterdescription.para: the fine resolution historical file
the coarse resolution historical file
the number of generations since the historical state was achieved
the rate of habitat change towards the historical state

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< string > path_fine, vector< unsigned long > number_fine, vector< double > rate_fine, vector< double > time_fine, vector< string > path_coarse, vector< unsigned long > number_coarse, vector< double > rate_coarse, vector< double > time_coarse)
memberdef.name: setHistoricalMapParameters

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &fine_map_file_in, const string &coarse_map_file_in, const string &sample_mask_file_in, const unsigned long &grid_x_size_in, const unsigned long &grid_y_size_in, const unsigned long &sample_x_size_in, const unsigned long &sample_y_size_in, const unsigned long &sample_x_offset_in, const unsigned long &sample_y_offset_in, const unsigned long &fine_map_x_size_in, const unsigned long &fine_map_y_size_in, const unsigned long &fine_map_x_offset_in, const unsigned long &fine_map_y_offset_in, const unsigned long &coarse_map_x_size_in, const unsigned long &coarse_map_y_size_in, const unsigned long &coarse_map_x_offset_in, const unsigned long &coarse_map_y_offset_in, const unsigned long &coarse_map_scale_in, const double &deme_in, const double &deme_sample_in, bool uses_spatial_sampling_in)
memberdef.name: setMapParameters

briefdescription.para: Sets the map parameters for the simulation.

parameterdescription.para: the fine resolution density map
the coarse resolution density map
the spatial sampling mask
the x dimension of the grid
the y dimension of the grid
the x dimension of the sample mask
the y dimension of the sample mask
the x offset of the sample mask from the grid
the y offset of the sample mask from the grid
the x dimension of the fine map
the y dimension of the fine map
the x offset of the fine map from the sample mask
the y offset of the fine map from the sample mask
the x dimension of the coarse map
the y dimension of the coarse map
the x offset of the coarse map from the fine map
the y offset of the coarse map from the fine map
the scale of the coarse map compared to the fine map
the number of individuals per cell
the proportion of individuals to sample from each cell
if the sample mask denotes differing spatial sampling proportions

briefdescription.para: Updates the historical map parameters to the next item in the deque.

simplesect.para: bool true if we need to re-import the maps (i.e. the historical maps have changed between updates)

briefdescription.para: Checks if there will be another update to be performed on the map.

simplesect.para: true if another map update exists

briefdescription.para: Parses the historical map data and creates the queue of historical maps.
Prints selected important variables to the terminal.

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long &metacommunity_size, const long double &speciation_rate, const unsigned long &seed, const unsigned long &job_type)
memberdef.name: setMetacommunityParameters

parameterdescription.para: the number of individuals in the community
the speciation rate for the metacommunity
the seed for the simulation
the job referencing number

briefdescription.para: Overloading the << operator for outputting to the output stream.

parameterdescription.para: the output stream.
the SimParameters object.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the >> operator for inputting from an input stream.

parameterdescription.para: the input stream
the mapvars object

briefdescription.para: Stores and imports the variables required by the Map object. Used to setting the Map variables in a more elegant way.
